definition: variant of 蹺|跷[qiao1]/to raise one's foot/stilts
to raise one's foot/to stand on tiptoe/stilts

sentences.english: If you plan on not attending class, make sure you have a buddy that will sign u in.
sentences.chinese: 要是你打算跷课，先保证有个家伙能帮你签到。

sentences.english: Although some of my daughter's friends cut class a lot, she is at school everyday.
sentences.chinese: 虽然我女儿的朋友经常跷课，她可是每天都上学。

sentences.english: And the Mirage is such a great place to hang out.
sentences.chinese: 而这样一个伟大的地方是幻影跷课。

sentences.english: I feel like ditching this class.
Just hang out all those Negative Thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些负面的想法只是跷课。

sentences.english: The schoolboy is often cutting classes and playing hooky.
sentences.chinese: 那男生经常跷课和逃学。

sentences.english: More and more students are cutting classes these days.
sentences.chinese: 最近愈来愈多学生跷课了。

definition: to skip work/to sneak out of work early
to go to class/to attend class/to go to teach a class
to leave early (before the stipulated finishing time)/to retire early (from one's job)
(Tw) teacher in charge of a class/homeroom teacher
(coll.) to sit in on a class
